content.div:
As we all know, Community is currently "benched" by NBC (whatever that means), and while NBC says it'll return later this year, the future is uncertain for the students Greendale Community College.

With that in mind, actor/rapper Donald Glover (who plays Troy on the show) took time out of his busy Childish Gambino touring schedule to appeal to the hearts, minds and campaign letter writers of the world to demand Community's safe return.

"People have stopped laughing, bees have stopped making honey and no one has died for 48 hours," Glover says in the video, which was made during a recent interview with MTV News Canada

"I know, I get it; 30 Rock, Parks and Rec, they're holding you over. It's not the same" Glover adds (because someone had to).

See the full video below and then follow Glover's advice by contacting your "governor or district leader" because people need to die, people!

jond@dose.ca

link.Abstract: A week after NBC announced it was benching Community for 30 Rock's return, the show's stars have started speaking out about what the decision could mean for its future and the online support it's received.
link.title: Community Stars React To Show's "Benching"

link.Abstract: NBC announced Monday night that it will be “benching” Community to make room in January for Are You There, Chelsea?, a new comedy based on the life of Chelsea Handler, and the return of 30 Rock.
link.title: NBC 'Benches' Community for 30 Rock

link.Abstract: The Greendale gang is going back to school, and judging from the new promo NBC just dropped, the show has no plans to tone down its wacky appeal.
link.title: Watch the Promo for Community's Third Season

link.Abstract: What does Joel McHale have to say about America's Got Talent? The Playboy Club? Community? McHale lampooned NBC and all "those who have the power to destroy" him during a surprise appearance at the summer meeting of the TV Critics Association.
link.title: Community's Joel McHale Tears Into NBC's Fall Schedule

link.Abstract: Martin Starr (Freaks and Geeks, Party Down) will appear on season three of NBC's Community.
link.title: Martin Starr Joining Community's Cast of Freaks and Geeks
